title.label: I love it, though I wish it was more challenging

content.label: I like everything about it from the concept, the drawing and the variety of the levels. However, I think some levels even the latter ones were easy to win. I don't remember when I started playing but I think I finished it all in 1 1/2-2 hrs. So I wish it could get more difficult. Other than that, nice game :)
Great design and fun gameplay, but the number of levels and amount of content are not even close enough to warrant $2.99. I played through the entire thing in two days of light playing.

I downloaded this merely because this is the first time EVER that I have seen a developer take time out to respond to the customer base. That alone inspired me to download the game. I've only played one planet. Great stress free game thus far. I hope that you will continue to communicate with the public.Those who complain about the price may be forgetting that you can't buy much these days for $3 and you certainly deserve something for the hours put in to create such a game. Congrats and here's to a successful following.

Can't wait for more levels! There will be, right? I wish there were more as I have finished many of the levels in a day. Adorable aliens, they are sooo cute. Also the music is awesome.
Update: Thanks for the fast feedback! Of all the games I have reviewed this is the first. You guys are doing an awesome job. I love your cute aliens.
This game is the best. There is cute critters, oustanding music, and challenging (but fun) levels. Spending 3 bucks is completely worth it!
Love it, beat all of it, needs more levels
I liked this a lot. Something different and has an original mechanic and some nice puzzles. Over 50 levels, including the bonus levels.

Bought game yesterday ~ disappointed ~ maybe was expecting more because of all the hype.  Seems one endless level after another with no overall map to show you where you are in the game. 

Update:  You do see the map when you finish a planet but not during the planet.  I've played other games where you see the map after finishing each play.  It's satisfying to see the completed games in each planet as well as the completed planets.
This game is fun, and very cute, but there just aren't enough levels. It's just not fair to charge $3 for a game that can be finished in a day.
Perfect game if you liked lemmings
This game is stupendous! The design is so cute and the gameplay is challenging and original. I just wish there were more games like this out there!
Please add more levels

This app is the most challenging but fun app I have ever played. You really had to think on most of the levels. My only request is that Splitter Critters/RAC7 Games makes more levels because I beat the whole game in 1 day but I really don't want to stop!
Very original and well executed concept will have you thinking
My critter gets frozen when going to the ship every time I do it on the last mission.

title.label: Awesome game but... needs more levels

content.label: Ok so I just got this game and after like 15 minutes of playing it I'm already on the third planet. And there is only five planets. It's not necessarily easy but it's not that hard either. I'm not gonna be too critical because this is a new game but I'm really hoping that they are working on some new levels. If they don't then I don't recommend this game.
Not worth the money.
This is an original game, but it's too simple and too short for the $3 price.  That said, it has a lot of potential and I hope the developers keep going with the idea.
Cool mechanic, very unique puzzle game.

title.label: This game is getting better thru updates.

content.label:
I read a few positive reviews, saw that the game was about the price of the smallest Starbucks café latte, and decided to buy it.

They just issued an update to fix the fact that after a user zooms out, the game used to insist on zooming back in after a few seconds. So I'll knock my score up a point for that. 

I just now hit a level where I think I learned that the the rules are that I only get so many tears per level, although I'm still not entirely sure that's the rule. I just know that for some reason the "cursor" turns red and I can't do another tear.

A rule like "the yellow guy always hops down when he can" are in-universe, and make sense that you have to discover them as you play. A rule like having a fixed number of tears per level is clearly an (arbitrary) game mechanic and seems like it should be taught differently than the in-universe rules.

I felt the same way about discovering that moves alternate between one tear, then one drag, then one tear, then one drag. (i.e., once you have dragged a piece, you can't drag it again.) I can see where they did it this way to keep the set of user actions simple and learnable, but combined with the limited number of moves, found it annoying.

I wondered if I could turn off the music. However, the only commands from the pause menu were Restart, Resume, and Level Select. I took a shot and tried "Level Select," and sure enough, there was a button for Settings on the Level Select screen.

My suggestion: Put a 4th button on the Pause menu: "Settings."

In the latest update, you can now turn off the music! A nice improvement. 

There's an unexplained "Battery Saver" setting. This game could use a bit of optional help text somewhere. 

There are quirks that are interesting, enough that I don't dismiss them as design flaws, but rather they potentially interesting mechanic. I'm thinking specifically of the exact behavior of the Undo button.

I'll probably come back and knock my rating up if I keep playing and the game seems interesting enough that I get over my annoyance with these early flaws.
Great game but how can I turn off the music and/or sound so I can play my own tunes while I puzzle?
I like the concept, but the levels can get large and challenging to move around he screen.  My brain inherently associates swiping with "moving the screen" so I have many ill-placed "cuts".
If you like unusual challenge of ripping a paper up to save the cute little guys, this game is fun to be stumped, save the little guys. You will not disappointed, enjoying this game a lot
Favorite new game
There is a crash upon completion of level 20. Love the game though!
Cute game helps with boredom however I got up to level 20 and Everytime I pass the level the games closes so I can't get past level 20. Please help me.

Firstly, this is an AMAZING game! The graphics, gameplay, and even the soundtrack is totally original and very polished! However I do have some complaints :

1. It's lacking in content... like badly... and due to this fact I feel like $2.99 was kind of a rip off. It should have been more like $0.99 based on the content you get. So get levels out as quickly as possible while still being able to maintain the polishing and quality of the game.

2. You have built a game where the sky is the limit. There are limitless possibilities for level design. New types of aliens with different abilities, different enemies, different obstacles, etc.  HOWEVER, once again we have to have new content QUICKLY to keep this game alive. 

3. Lastly, I would like some customization. Maybe different hats or something to put on the little aliens etc. just fun stuff. The biggest thing, customization wise, I would LOVE to see would be a level designer. That way on top of regular content drops with levels, you could build your own and upload them and also play other people's levels. Which in turn, would give the player virtually endless content.

I really want to see this game succeed, as well made as it is. I feel like these ideas could go a long way in establishing a long lasting player base for the game. Gameplay is perfect, not to easy and not to hard. Just enough to make you really think, but not enough for you to  get stuck, and then get frustrated, and then delete the game. Overall almost perfect game! Keep it up!

This game is so good. All the other games get boring after like 10 minutes but this game is so much fun. I think that this game should have more levels however they said in the most recent update that they added new levels and more on the way so I think that is great! If you are wondering to get this game or not, I suggest get it right away take my advice!
Loved it! Very original.
And no instructions.
Simple to play. I like how it makes you have to think but not too much. Any age can play it. Worth the money to buy.

It's good, and cute/forgiving enough for kids and the twitch challenged. Occupied me for an hour, and I'll probably keep it loaded for occasional distraction. Not addictive, but that's a good thing sometimes.

What a perfect puzzler. This puzzler causes you to think in so many different ways on how you are going to get the critters to their spaceships. On every puzzle there are different ways to complete them causing you do always have your options. Also, every level is different, some levels you have to complete fast and some you can take as long as you want. Overall this game is astonishing and beautiful.
Puzzle and charming. Good difficulty for adults and kids
But gets boring fast. Beautiful artwork simplicity and clever core mechanic. But not enough satisfaction.
Great game and concept but just not enough for $2.99. I beat all the levels and the 3 extra ones in 20-30 minutes while sitting on the pot. I shouldn't be able to do that on a puzzle level game.
I have never written a review before, but this game is so good. I just want more levels. I played through this game at least 3 times already. If you're debating getting the game, it is well worth it.
I love this game good to kill time in the car waiting for dinner or sitting on your couch good quick pick up game 5 star
Beat game in 2 hours. Fun, but way too short for price.
This game was a lot of fun. It was one of the best puzzle games I've played in a while. I hope to maybe see more content in the future

I did really enjoy this game. It was creative and fun. However, I don't feel like this is worth $3. I finished this game in about 2 hours because of the shortage of levels. If this game had more gameplay, it would definitely get a 5 star

title.label: Good game, not with the money

content.label: Good graphics and concept, but WAY TOO EASY. I beat the entire thing in an an hour or so. Too expensive for the short game play. Hopefully the levels will continue to come.
Super smooth gameplay and graphics and indeed a good puzzle. I don't rate much but had to for this one
One of the better puzzle games I've played on IOS. Easy to play and nice to look at, this game is worth the $3 price tag.
Great game, albeit a little short. Innovative gameplay makes this game a winner. No IAP seals the deal.
Clever, fun, polished
Brilliant mechanics, cute art, and compelling puzzles. Really wonderful game!
Super fun, just need more levels!!
This game is a ton of fun and has really unique gameplay involved. It's not often I spend money on apps but I can definitely say I want disappointed!
I thought this game looked cool and it is better then cool there are no glitches it's interesting and fun I played the first two worlds and got hooked on it.
